2011.11999v1.title: Conundrums at Finite Density
2011.11999v1.summary:
Extending the successes of lattice quantum chromodynamics(QCD) at zero as
well as nonzero temperatures to nonzero density is extremely desirable in view
of the quest for the QCD phase diagram both theoretically and experimentally.
It turns out though to give rise to some conundrums whose resolution may assist
progress in this exciting but difficult area, and should therefore be sought
actively.

hep-th/0606107v1.title: Hidden symmetry and Hopf algebra
hep-th/0606107v1.summary:
We spell two conundrums, one of physical and another of mathematical nature,
and explain why one helps to elucidate the other
